name: Quizzical44: Easy Word Search | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: Capital city found in Jerome Kern's 'Show Boat'?
questions.explanation:
Rome & rome.

	jeROME. Rome is the capital city of Italy

questions.text: An aromatic plant such as parsley or rosemary can be found with George Herbert Walker Bush?
questions.explanation:
Herb & herb.

	HERBert. Parsley or rosemary is a herb.

questions.text: Who said Bette Midler is lazy?
questions.explanation:
Idle & idle.

	mIDLEr. Idle is another word for lazy.

questions.text: Can this tree survive St. Elmo's fire?
questions.explanation:
Elm & elm & Fir & fir.

	ELMo's. The tree is an elm or fir from FIRe

questions.text: How did John Logie Baird mix nitrogen and oxygen together to form the earth's atmosphere?
questions.explanation:
Air & air.

	bAIRd. Air is the earth's atmosphere and consists of approximately 78 percent nitrogen and 21 percent oxygen.

questions.text: Richard Dreyfuss provides the squirrel's nest?
questions.explanation:
Drey & drey.

	DREYfuss. A drey is the nest of a squirrel.

questions.text: Was Dwight David Eisenhower enthusiastic?
questions.explanation:
Avid & avid.

	dAVID. Avid means enthusiastic.

questions.text: Can this car manufacturer be found in Saudi Arabia?
questions.explanation:
Audi & audi.

	sAUDI. Audi is the car manufacturer.

questions.text: Does Heather like riesling?
questions.explanation:
Ling & ling.

	riesLING. Another name for heather is ling. Riesling is a dry white wine from the Rhine valley in Germany.

questions.text: Any of the twenty-four curved arches of bone found in Kiribati?
questions.explanation:
Rib & rib.

	kiRIBati. We have 24 ribs which form the chest.

questions.text: A common European freshwater fish found in Franz Peter Schubert's 'Hark, Hark the Lark'?
questions.explanation:
Chub & chub.

	sCHUBert's. The chub is a freshwater fish.

questions.text: Can we alter Archangel, a port in Russia on the Dvina river?
questions.explanation:
Change & change.

	arCHANGEl. Another name for alter is change.

questions.text: This Shakespearean king can be found with the American group, Creedence Clearwater Revival?
questions.explanation:
Lear & lear.

	cLEARwater. King Lear was the Shakespearean king.

questions.text: A food fish of the Northern hemisphere, has an elongated body with a large head just like William Shakespeare?
questions.explanation:
Hake & hake.

	sHAKEspeare. The hake is the food fish with an elongated body and a large head.

questions.text: This Greek letter is found with Catherine Zeta Jones?
questions.explanation:
zeta.

	Zeta is the sixth letter of the Greek alphabet.

questions.text: Sir Anthony Hopkins wasn't born in this country?
questions.explanation:
Iran & iran.

	sIR ANthony. Iran being the country.

questions.text: Body organ found in Oliver Goldsmith's 'She Stoops to Conquer'?
questions.explanation:
Liver & liver.

	oLIVER. The body organ is the liver.

questions.text: An earthenware beer mug held by Albert Einstein in Liechtenstein?
questions.explanation:
Stein & stein.

	einSTEIN or liechtenSTEIN. A stein is the name of the earthenware mug.

questions.text: A large body of matter without a definite shape must be a weight off Thomas Stearns Eliot's mind?
questions.explanation:
Mass & mass.

	thoMAS Stearns. Mass is a large body of matter without definite shape.

questions.text: Did the 1991 Nobel prize winner for chemistry, Richard Robert Ernst, find the aquatic bird?
questions.explanation:
Tern & tern.

	roberT ERNst. The aquatic bird is the tern.

questions.text: This troutlike fish occurs in cold lakes, northern seas and is found in Richard Wagner's opera 'Siegfried'?
questions.explanation:
Char & char.

	riCHARard. The char is a troutlike fish.

questions.text: An elaborate accompanied song for solo voice is found with New York City born Mariah Carey?
questions.explanation:
Aria & aria.

	mARIAh. An elaborate accompanied song for solo voice is called an aria.

questions.text: Informally, Hades, is found living with Michelle Pfeiffer in the Seychelles?
questions.explanation:
Hell & hell.

	micHELLe or seycHELLes. Informally Hades is a word for hell.

questions.text: Does cricketer Imran Khan know where the tall cross with a loop on the top is located?
questions.explanation:
Ankh & ankh.

	imrAN KHan. The ankh is the name of the tall cross with a loop on the top, symbolizing eternal life.

questions.text: Music by 'Duke' Ellington contains a red ochre stain used for marking sheep?
questions.explanation:
Keel & keel.

	duKE ELlington. Keel is the red ochre stain used for marking sheep. Hope you enjoyed this cryptic quiz.
